page.title: 20Education in Cliffe
page.content: Cliffe School was founded in 1708 when Mary Waud left money to provide education for poor children. The school built then stayed on the same site in York Road until 1982, when a new one was built in Main Street, just outside the area of this survey. Children from 4 to 11 come to Cliffe School, then they go to Barlby High School. This year there are 63 pupils in three classes in the school. This survey was made by children in the top class: Lindsay Bowskill, Yvonne Calvert, Richard Chatham, Joseph Chatterton,Catherine Hayselden, Jane Hinchliffe, Gillian Kirby, Brian Miles, Ellen Murphy, Lisa Rickard, James Robinson, Ruth Simpson, Alison Skinner, Deborah and Michael Smith, Matthew Smith, Richard Smith, Colin Stephens, Claire Thompson, David Tomlinson and Peter Tune.
